titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George A. Harding family papers circa 1895-1945

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-07-16.

langusage.language: Finding aid is written in English.

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

physdesc.extent: 5 document cases, 1 flat box and 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: Collection includes correspondence, documents, business records, genealogy, ephemera, diaries, and account books of members of the George A. Harding family; blueprints and notebooks of George Lee Harding, circa 1919-1945, regarding his work on the Smith Cove Pier B in Seattle, Washington, the Port of Tacoma, etc. Also included are an architectural drawing of the Harding Building on Main Street in Oregon City and a plat map of Palmer's Addition in Boring, Oregon; scrapbook; and photocopy journals of George A. Harding, 1862.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Virginia Harding Lewis and Helene Harding Brooke, June 10, 1967 (Lib. Acc. 10324).

bioghist.p: George A. Harding arrived in Oregon in 1857, served in the Union Army, was director of the Willamette Valley Southern Railway and operated a drugstore in Oregon City. In 1877, he married Margaret Jennie Barlow, daughter of J. L. Barlow. They had six children: Jennie Imogene (Harding Brodie), George Lee Harding, Carleton Barlow Harding, Nieta Natalie Harding, Lloyd Ordway (Ben) and Evelyn Harding. In 1915, George Lee married Helene Ferrer, who died of cancer in 1936. They had three daughters: Suzannah Harding, Helene (Harding) Rigger and Virginia (Harding) Lewis.

prefercite.p: George A. Harding Family papers, Mss 2000, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

relatedmaterial.p: George A. Harding family photograph album, Album 158, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, documents, business records, genealogy, ephemera, diaries, and account books of members of the George A. Harding family; blueprints and notebooks of George Lee Harding, circa 1919-1945, regarding his work on the Smith Cove Pier B in Seattle, Washington, the Port of Tacoma, etc. Also included are an architectural drawing of the Harding Building on Main Street in Oregon City and a plat map of Palmer's Addition in Boring, Oregon; scrapbook; and photocopy journals of George A. Harding, 96 pages, 1862.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society owns the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from copyright owners.

bibliography.p: 1862 journal of George A. Harding was published in Oregon Historical Quarterly, Summer 1978, Vol. 79, No. 2, pages 172-202.
